item.title: Tracey add a quote by Quentin Crisp
item.description: "The key is never, never work. Nothing is more aging than work. It's not only the strain of getting up in the morning for work, but it's the resentment that settles on your face" -- Quentin Crisp

item.title: Tracey add a quote by Harlan Ellison
item.description: "You are not entitled to your opinion. You are entitled to your <i>informed</i> opinion. No one is entitled to be ignorant." -- Harlan Ellison

item.title: Tracey add a quote by Harlan Ellison
item.description: "The two most common elements in the universe are Hydrogen and stupidity." -- Harlan Ellison

item.title: Tracey add a quote by Ray Bradbury
item.description: "You don't have to burn books to destroy a culture. Just get people to stop reading them." -- Ray Bradbury

item.title: Tracey add a quote by Ray Bradbury
item.description: "If we listened to our intellect we'd never have a love affair. We'd never have a friendship. We'd never go in business because we'd be cynical: "It's gonna go wrong." Or "She's going to hurt me." Or,"I've had a couple of bad love affairs, so therefore . . ." Well, that's nonsense. You're going to miss life. You've got to jump off the cliff all the time and build your wings on the way down." -- Ray Bradbury

item.title: Tracey add a quote by Robert A. Heinlein
item.description: "You have attributed conditions to villainy that simply result from stupidity." -- Robert A. Heinlein

item.title: Tracey add a quote by Robert A. Heinlein
item.description: "Love is that condition in which the happiness of another person is essential to your own." -- Robert A. Heinlein

item.title: Tracey add a quote by Robert A. Heinlein
item.description: "The most preposterous notion that Homo sapiens has ever dreamed up is that the Lord God of Creation, Shaper and Ruler of all the Universes, wants the saccharine adoration of His creatures, can be swayed by their prayers, and becomes petulant if He does not receive this flattery. Yet this absurd fantasy, without a shred of evidence to bolster it, pays all the expenses of the oldest, largest, and least productive industry in all history." -- Robert A. Heinlein

item.title: Tracey add a quote by Robert A. Heinlein
item.description: "No woman ever ages beyond eighteen in her heart." -- Robert A. Heinlein

item.title: Tracey add a quote by Lois McMaster Bujold
item.description: "I've always thought tests are a gift. And great tests are a great gift. To fail the test is a misfortune. But to refuse the test is to refuse the gift, and something worse, more irrevocable, than misfortune." -- Lois McMaster Bujold

item.title: Tracey add a quote by Lois McMaster Bujold
item.description: "Reputation is what other people know about you. Honor is what you know about yourself." -- Lois McMaster Bujold

item.title: Tracey add a quote by Lois McMaster Bujold
item.description: "All the geniuses I ever met were so just part of the time. To qualify, you only have to be great once, you know. Once when it matters." -- Lois McMaster Bujold

item.title: Tracey add a quote by Neil Gaiman
item.description: "Most books on witchcraft will tell you that witches work naked. This is because most books on witchcraft were written by men." -- Neil Gaiman

item.title: Tracey add a quote by Lemony Snicket
item.description: "People aren't either wicked or noble. They're like chef's salads, with good things and bad things chopped and mixed together in a vinaigrette of confusion and conflict." -- Lemony Snicket

item.title: Tracey add a quote by Doris Lessing
item.description: "That is what learning is. You suddenly understand something you've understood all your life, but in a new way." -- Doris Lessing

item.title: Tracey add a quote by Terry Pratchett
item.description: "It was lonely on the hill, and cold. And all you could do was keep going. You could scream, cry, and stamp your feet, but apart from making you feel warmer, it wouldn’t do any good. You could say it was unfair, and that was true, but the universe didn’t care because it didn’t know what “fair” meant. That was the big problem about being a witch. It was up to you. It was always up to you." -- Terry Pratchett

item.title: Tracey add a quote by Terry Pratchett
item.description: "Everywhere I look, I see something holy." -- Terry Pratchett

item.title: Tracey add a quote by Terry Pratchett
item.description: "I'd rather be a rising ape than a falling angel." -- Terry Pratchett

item.title: Tracey add a quote by Terry Pratchett
item.description: "His philosophy was a mixture of three famous schools -- the Cynics, the Stoics and the Epicureans -- and summed up all three of them in his famous phrase, 'You can't trust any bugger further than you can throw him, and there's nothing you can do about it, so let's have a drink." -- Terry Pratchett

item.title: Tracey add a quote by Terry Pratchett
item.description: "Gods prefer simple, vicious games, where you Do Not Achieve Transcendence but Go Straight To Oblivion; a key to the understanding of all religion is that a god's idea of amusement is Snakes and Ladders with greased rungs." -- Terry Pratchett

item.title: Tracey add a quote by Terry Pratchett
item.description: "Give a man a fire and he's warm for a day, but set fire to him and he's warm for the rest of his life." -- Terry Pratchett

item.title: Tracey add a quote by Terry Pratchett
item.description: "Just erotic. Nothing kinky. It's the difference between using a feather and using a chicken." -- Terry Pratchett

item.title: Tracey add a quote by Terry Pratchett
item.description: "I'll be more enthusiastic about encouraging thinking outside the box when there's evidence of any thinking going on inside it." -- Terry Pratchett

item.title: Tracey add a quote by Terry Pratchett
item.description: "It's not worth doing something unless someone, somewhere, would much rather you weren't doing it." -- Terry Pratchett

item.title: Tracey add a quote by J.K. Rowling
item.description: "I took a wrong turn on the way to the bathroom and found myself in a beautifully proportioned room I had never seen before, containing a really rather magnificent collection of chamberpots. When I went back to investigate more closely, I discovered that the room had vanished. But I must keep an eye out for it. Possibly it is only accessible at five thirty in the morning. Or it may only appear at the quarter moon - or when the seeker has an exceptionally full bladder." -- J.K. Rowling

item.title: Tracey add a quote by Ursula K. LeGuin
item.description: "What sane person could live in this world and not be crazy?" -- Ursula K. LeGuin

item.title: Tracey add a quote by Douglas Adams
item.description: "Don't Panic." -- Douglas Adams

item.title: Tracey add a quote by Orson Scott Card
item.description: "She worked her toes into the sand, feeling the tiny delicious pain of the friction of tiny chips of silicon against the tender flesh between her toes. That's life. It hurts, it's dirty, and it feels very, very good." -- Orson Scott Card

item.title: Tracey add a quote by J.R.R. Tolkien
item.description: "I wish it need not have happened in my time," said Frodo. "So do I," said Gandalf, "and so do all who live to see such times. But that is not for them to decide. All we have to decide is what to do with the time that is given us." -- J.R.R. Tolkien

item.title: Tracey add a quote by George Orwell
item.description: "In a time of deceit telling the truth is a revolutionary act." -- George Orwell
